info.title: Solution API
info.description: The user-centered Solution API makes it possible to build customised energy applications.

get.description: Get the account that is currently logged in.

patch.description: Update the user data of the authenticated account.

get.summary: Retrieve energy market prices for the authenticated account
get.description:
List energy market prices for the given interval. Prices are fetched from an external energy market
platform.
For the given interval, the hourly prices of the second to last day and for the last day are returned in a 60M resolution.
For all the other days in the interval, the average daily price is returned.
For example, in order to get hourly prices for the current day and the day before, set the **end** of the interval to the current day.

**Deprecated** - Use `/systems/{systemID}/tariff/prices` instead.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description:
Specifies an external platform to receive the energy market prices from (currently only one supported).
- "entso-e": Fetch prices from ENTSO-E Transparency Platform.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description:
Specifies an Area-Code which is currently in use of the European markets.

If set, the default bidding zone set in the account is ignored.
More details about the bidding zones, can be found [here](https://transparency.entsoe.eu/content/static_content/Static%20content/web%20api/Guide.html#_areas).

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Requested time interval for fetching prices in UTC.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Timezone in which all related times should be loaded before being returned.

get.description:
List of scans for the given gateway and the given interval.

If no interval is specified, the entire period is considered and all scans are listed.
List jobs that belong to the given gateway.
Gets a particular job that belongs to the given gateway. In this case, the path parameter should be a job ID.

post.summary: Create a job with a given type
post.description:
Creates a job with the given type for the given gateway, only if a job with that type doesn't already exist.
In this case, the path parameter should be a job type. Please note that the job type is case-sensitive.

  * `SCAN`: Once this job is triggered, the gridBox will look for connected appliances and update the list accordingly.

  * `RESET`: This type of job resets gridBox to default and removes it from previously configured system.

  * `RESTART`: Once this job is triggered, the gridBox will restart.

*Job execution is asynchronous and does not guarantee immediate execution.*

delete.description: Cancels a particular job from the given gateway. In this case, the path parameter should be a job ID.

Each entry in the array is a separate appliance. If no appliance is available, the resulting array will be empty.

get.description:

The saving is **cached** and can be refreshed by specifying the corresponding URL parameter.

get.summary: Retrieve the tariff end prices of a system
get.description:
Retrieves the end-price tariff for the system in the specified resolution (15-minute by default if not specified).
The end-price is the price the customer is billed for (for market data tariffs for example after offset, VAT and provider fee are applied).

Depending on the tariff settings, the tariff data might have been directly posted through the API, originate from market data 
or is extrapolated from static data.

If the resolution of the underlying data doesn't correspond to the requested resolution the data will be up- or down-sampled.
For example the market prices used by market data tariffs have a 1 hour resolution. If you request 15min resolution you will
get 4 equal periods per hour. If you request daily resolution, the average prices of 24 hourly periods will be returned per period.  

If there are missing price periods over the requested interval (which may happen for `EXTERNAL` tariffs), the end-price tariff will start after the last period gap, aligned with the requested resolution.
That is, if the requested interval for a given day is from 00:00 to 12:00 and no prices were sent from at 02:15 to 03:45, the first period returned will be from 03:45 to 04:00 for a 15-min resolution or from 04:00 to 05:00 for an hourly resolution.

Once calculated the prices won't change anymore for the requested period.
Even if the tariff is reconfigured the returned price will stay the same.
This is due to the fact that historical prices can not be changed anymore. 
Changes in the tariff will only have an effect in the future.

The returned currency is determined by the currency of the underlying tariff if not specified otherwise.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
Requested time interval for fetching end-price tariff in the RFC3339 format.
If the available tariff data does not cover the full interval, the largest available subset will still be returned.
If the lower bound of the interval is not a multiple of the resolution, it will be truncated.
If the upper bound of the interval is not a multiple of the resolution, it will be rounded up.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description:
Resolution of the end-price tariff periods as ISO8601 duration.
If not specified it will be a 15-min resolution.

Possible resolutions are:
- PT15M - 15 minutes
- PT1H - 1 hour
- P1D - 1 day

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description:
Currency in which the end prices should be returned.

If the underlying data isn't already in the requested currency, the prices will be converted.
This uses exchange rates with a daily resolution.

200.description:
End-price tariff of the system for the interval requested.
If the system has no tariff and therefore no end prices can be calculated the returned periods will be empty.

post.summary: Set tariff end prices of a system
post.description:
Sets the tariff end prices for **external tariffs**.

The sent price periods have a few restrictions:
- They must have a 15 minute resolution.
- They must not have gaps for current and future prices (gaps in the past are allowed).

The prices can be sent in all supported currencies and will be converted by the `GET /tariff/prices` endpoint accordingly.

You don't have to send your prices in all the currencies you want to support.
Internally they always will be converted to Euro, therefore sending the same price periods in different currencies will overwrite
the previously sent price periods.

201.description:
Price periods successfully inserted.

Returns an end-price tariff with all inserted price periods.

get.summary: Get time of use optimization decisions of a system.
get.description:
Get optimization decisions and associated metrics for a system with `system_id`,
within given time interval. Note that decisions may not always cover the complete time interval.
Only decisions with `start_at` in the past are returned.
The maximum time interval that can be requested is 48 hours.

200.description: Array of optimization decisions and associated metrics.

get.summary: Get the Time-of-Use forecasts for the grid connection point.
get.description:
The Time-of-Use (ToU) optimization runs on a given resolution of 15 minutes.
For each time segment, i.e. `[10:00, 10:15]` it publishes a series of forecasts for
the grid connection point associated with a system with `systemID`.

This endpoint requires to specify a time window called `interval` for which the forecasts are returned.
For example `[2021-01-01T02:07:14Z, 2021-01-02T02:07:14Z]`.
If no interval is provided it is assumed to be `[00:00:00 today, 00:00:00 in two days]`.
The maximum size of this interval is 48h.

This endpoint returns the forecasts **in the selected time window**.
Please note that the forecasts might not cover the whole time window.
In this case the largest possible subset is returned.
If no forecast is available, an empty list is returned.

200.description: Successful request. Retrieved forecasts for the given parameters.

get.summary: Get the last updated timestamp for the Time-of-Use forecasts for the grid connection point.
get.description:
The Time-of-Use (ToU) optimization runs on a given resolution of 15 minutes.
For each time segment, i.e. `[10:00, 10:15]` it publishes a series of forecasts for
the grid connection point associated with a system with `systemID`.

This endpoint requires to specify a time window called `interval` for which the forecasts are returned.
For example `[2021-01-01T02:07:14Z, 2021-01-02T02:07:14Z]`.
If no interval is provided it is assumed to be `[00:00:00 today, 00:00:00 in two days]`.
The maximum size of this interval is 48h.

This endpoint returns the last timestamp RFC3339 format when the forecasts **in the selected time window**
were updated.

200.description: Successful request. Retrieved last update time for the given parameters.

lastUpdated.description: Last time when the prediction where updated.

get.summary: Get the historical status of the Time-of-Use service.
get.description:
The Time-of-Use (ToU) optimization runs on a given resolution of 15 minutes.
For each time segment, i.e. `[10:00, 10:15]` it publishes an operational status
associated with a system with `systemID`.

This endpoint requires to specify a time window called `interval` for which the status data are returned.
For example `[2021-01-01T02:07:14Z, 2021-01-02T02:07:14Z]`.
If no interval is provided it is assumed to be `[now - 48h, now]`.
The maximum size of this interval is 48h.
Please note that the statuses might not cover the whole time window.

200.description: Successful request. Retrieved historical status for given parameters.

get.summary: Get the last known status of the Time-of-Use service.
get.description:
The Time-of-Use (ToU) optimization runs on a given resolution of 15 minutes.
For each time segment, i.e. `[10:00, 10:15]` it publishes an operational status for
associated with a system with `systemID`.

This endpoint provides the last known, or current, status of the Time-of-Use runs.

200.description: Successful request. Retrieved status for the given parameters.

get.summary: Evaluate whether the system is ready for enabling Time-of-Use.
get.description:
A series of operational prerequisites are required before enabling Time-of-Use (ToU) for a system.
The checks are done in order to evaluate the system's "readiness" for ToU.
In principal, checks pertaining to appliances used, price data used, as well as some system metadata are performed.

200.description: Successful request. Retrieved ToU readiness for the given parameters.

get.description:
__WARN: This API is only for internal usage!__

Gets information about the system's EMS capabilities. The latest reported list of capabilities is returned.

Empty response means no capabilities were reported by EMS so far. Full list of supported capabilities is maintained by gridBox team.
Retrieves a system's latest aggregated measurement.

Lists aggregated measurements of a system over a period of time.

System measurements are the result of incorporating measurements from 
all appliances that are part of a system. This allows computing e.g. 
overall consumption adding producers (e.g. PV) and subtracting consumers
(e.g. EV charging stations). This aggregation is performed in various 
resolutions to suit different use cases. See the 'resolution' parameter
for a list of options.

Depending on the resolution parameter, the response contains either
power or energy measurements (unless otherwise documented):
- **power** (unit: W): `15m`, `1h`
- **energy** (unit: Wh): `1d`, `1w`, `1M`, `1y`

Measurements are "aligned" differently whether they contain energy or
power measurements:
- For power values the data point is written after the aggregated time 
  span. For the interval 2018-04-01T00:00:00Z/2018-04-02T00:00:00Z
  with resolution 15m the first observation will be recorded at 
  2018-04-01T00:15:00Z
- For energy values the observation is stored at the beginning of 
  the aggregated time span. For the interval 
  2018-04-01T00:00:00Z/2018-04-05T00:00:00Z and resolution 1d the first 
  observation will be recorded at 2018-04-01T00:00:00Z

The `total` object of the response contains an aggregation of the 
individual data points over time and therefore is an energy value.
The `total.measuredAt` field is an interval containing all data points 
in the requested interval.

In order to reduce the duration of the endpoint, the gridX API imposes 
limitations on the interval for a given resolution:

| Resolution | Limit                   |
|------------|-------------------------|
| 15m        | intervals up to 1 day   |
| 1h         | intervals up to 1 week  |
| 1d         | intervals up to 1 month |
| 1w         | intervals up to 1 month |
| 1M         | intervals up to 5 years |
| 1y         | no limit                |

Lists raw measurements of an appliance over a period of time.

The provided `interval` must not span more than 24 hours.

The resolution cannot be controlled. The granularity at which we store
measurements varies from appliance to appliance, firmware and 
configuration.

requestBody.description: Create appliance raw measurement that can be retrieved via the [appliance measurements](https://developer.gridx.ai/reference/get_gateways-gatewayid-appliances-applianceid-measurements-appliance-1) and influences the [system measurements](https://developer.gridx.ai/reference/get_systems-systemid-historical) endpoints.

400.description: The request body did not match the required format.

get.description:
Lists combinations of appliance measurements and energy management 
measurements. 

This endpoints adds a "convenience" method for fetching raw measurements 
and energy management measurements together, by combining them into a 
single measurement object. 

It is usually used to inspect the EMS behavior in correspondence to raw 
values reported by the appliance. 

The requested `interval` must not span more than 24 hours.

200.description: Combined measurements have been returned successfully.

get.description:
Lists energy management measurements of an appliance over a period of time.
Data points returned are emitted directly by the Energy Management
System (EMS), therefore the resolution cannot be controlled. The 
granularity at which we store measurements depends on the EMS mode and 
configuration. 
The provided `interval` must not span more than 24 hours.
Retrieves a cluster's latest aggregated measurement.

Lists aggregated measurements of a cluster over a period of time.

Cluster measurements are the result of incorporating measurements from 
all appliances that are part of a cluster. This allows computing e.g. 
overall consumption adding producers (e.g. PV) and subtracting consumers
(e.g. EV charging stations). This aggregation is performed in various 
resolutions to suit different use cases. See the 'resolution' parameter
for a list of options.

Depending on the resolution parameter, the response contains either
power or energy measurements (unless otherwise documented):
- **power** (unit: W): `10m`, `15m`, `1h`
- **energy** (unit: Wh): `1d`, `1w`, `1M`, `1y`

**Note**: Fetching historical measurements with 10m resolution works
only for intervals **before** 2021-06-15T00:00:00Z.

Measurements are "aligned" differently whether they contain energy or
power measurements:
- For power values the data point is written after the aggregated time 
  span. For the interval 2018-04-01T00:00:00Z/2018-04-02T00:00:00Z
  with resolution 15m the first observation will be recorded at 
  2018-04-01T00:15:00Z
- For energy values the observation is stored at the beginning of 
  the aggregated time span. For the interval 
  2018-04-01T00:00:00Z/2018-04-05T00:00:00Z and resolution 1h the first 
  observation will be recorded at 2018-04-01T00:00:00Z

patch.description:
A PATCH may be performed on startTime and endTime of an existing power sequence. 
If only one parameter is specified, the other is calculated from the accumulated duration of all power time slots for this sequence.
A device binding is needed before changing the power sequence. If a binding doesn't exist, it is first created and then the power sequence is updated.

tariffID.description: Unique identifier for the energy tariff.

planID.name: planID
planID.description: Unique identifier that can be used to access charge plans.

tagID.name: tagID
tagID.description: Unique identifier that can be used to access RFID tags.

prefix.name: prefix

accountID.name: accountID
accountID.description: Unique identifier used to access an account.

page.name: page
page.description: Requested page, to be used in combination with the `per_page` parameter.

perPage.name: per_page
perPage.description: Requested number of items per page.

sort.name: sort
sort.description: Sort results based on a key.

embed.name: embed
embed.description: Describes which embedded fields of the system should be populated.

groupID.name: groupID
groupID.description: Unique identifier that can be used to access policy groups.

userID.name: userID
userID.description: Unique identifier used to access a user.

deleteAuth0.name: delete-auth0
deleteAuth0.description: If set to `false`, it does not delete the user from Auth0.

notificationID.name: notificationID
notificationID.description: Unique identifier that can be used to access notifications.

applianceID.name: applianceID
applianceID.description: Unique identifier used to access an appliance.

memberID.name: memberID
memberID.description: Identifier of a member (Appliance ID/Cluster ID).

clusterID.name: clusterID
clusterID.description: Unique identifier used to access a cluster.

customerID.name: customerID
customerID.description:
customerID is universally unique identifier (UUID V4) used identify a
customer in our backend.

order.name: order
order.description: Order direction of the results, to be used in combination with `sort` parameter.

systemID.name: systemID
systemID.description: Unique identifier used to access a system.

gatewayID.name: gatewayID
gatewayID.description: Unique identifier used to access a gateway.

listAll.name: listAll
listAll.description:
Boolean value to define if all the appliances must be listed.
If absent or set to `false` child appliances of Hybrid Inverter would be skipped.

evProfileID.name: evProfileID
evProfileID.description: Unique identifier for an EV profile.

jobIDOrType.name: jobIDOrType
jobIDOrType.description:
Unique identifier for a job or the type of the job. 
In `POST` request the job **type** is used, in `GET` and `DELETE` requests job **ID**.

ToUForecastsTimeInterval.name: interval
ToUForecastsTimeInterval.description:
A time interval [start_timestamp, end_timestamp] encoded as a unique string start_timestamp/end_timestamp.
Each timestamp should be specified in the RFC3339 format.
The maximum time interval that can be requested is 48 hours.
IMPORTANT: it has to be fully URL encoded (also known as Percent-encoding), including the `/`.

interval.name: interval
interval.description:
Requested time interval, formatted in ISO8601.

In this format the start and end point of the interval are formatted according
to RFC3339 and separated by a slash "/".

resolution.name: resolution
resolution.description:
Requested resolution, formatted in ISO8601 units.

In this format the resolution is formatted with a single number and corresponding
ISO8601 date or time unit.

policyID.name: policyID
policyID.description: Unique identifier that can be used to access policy documents.

statementID.name: statementID
statementID.description: Unique identifier that can be used to refer to policy statements.

functionalityID.name: functionalityID
functionalityID.description: Unique identifier of the product functionality.

optionID.name: optionID
optionID.description: Unique identifier of the product option.

deviceID.name: deviceID
deviceID.description: ID of the SPINE device, specified by the manufacturer.

AssignPolicyDocumentToAccountRequestBody.description: Assigns a policy document to an account.

CreatePolicyGroupRequestBody.description: Creates a policy group and related documents.

MoveAccountRequestBody.description: Move an account into the target account with the provided targetID.

AssignSystemToAccount.description: Assign a system (and its customers) to an account.

UnassignSystemToAccount.description: Unassings a system (and its customers) from an account.

system.description: Minimal information about the System in which the Asset is being created.

lastHeartbeatReceivedAt.description: At what time the last heartbeat was received.

schema.description: A request to (partially) update an asset

system.description: Minimal information needed to check asset permission. Note: This property is for verification purposes only and it will not update or patch system ID.

lastHeartbeatReceivedAt.description: At what time the last heartbeat was received.

SetImportPowerLimitRequestBody.description: Set a gateway's import power limit.

SetUserLimitRequestBody.description: Set user capacity limit, price and enable or disable the limit.

SystemCreationRequestBody.description: The body of a system creation request.

assignProductOption.summary: Assign a product option to the system

AssignPolicyDocumentToGroupRequestBody.description: Policy document that should be assigned to a group.

UpdatePowerSequenceRequestBody.description: Update a power sequence for the given device.

GetAccountDocumentResponse.description:
Account document returned.
The MIME-Type and concrete content depends on the returned file.

GetGroupsByAccountResponse.description: Policy groups of the account returned.

GetAccountParentsResponse.description:
Account parents sorted hierarchical.
The first item is the parent of the passed account. 
The next is the parent of the parent of the passed account.

BadGatewayExceptionResponse.description: There has been an error from an upstream server.

InternalExceptionResponse.description: There has been an internal error on our side. We're looking into it.

HistoricalPowerLimitsNotFoundResponse.description: Historical import power limits not found.

UserAccounts.description: List of the accounts the user can access.

PlatformMapping.title: PlatformMapping
PlatformMapping.description: Represents a 1:1 mapping from a XENON account to a Platform workspace and application.

accountID.description: Unique identifier of a XENON account.

applicationID.description: Unique identifier of the corresponding platform application.

workspaceID.description: Unique identifier of the corresponding platform workspace.

ScanConfigurationSet.title: ScanConfiguration
ScanConfigurationSet.description: ScanConfiguration determines the behavior of a scan.

configuration.description: The names of the scanners in this configuration.

ScanConfiguration.title: ScanConfiguration
ScanConfiguration.description: ScanConfiguration determines the behavior of a scan.

accountID.description: The account ID the configuration belongs to.

configuration.description: The names of the scanners in this configuration.

createdAt.description: Date when the configuration was created.

updatedAt.description: Date when the configuration was updated the last time.

File.title: File
File.description: Used to represent a bunch of data related to files in the S3 bucket.

link.description: URI location of the uploaded file

id.description: Unique ID to identify the energy tariff.

name.description: Name of the energy tariff, to be chosen freely.

createdAt.description: Time at which the tariff was created in UTC using the RFC3339 format.

day.description: Numeric day of week. 1 means Monday and 7 means Sunday.

from.description: Time of day in seconds at which the period starts, e.g. 07:00 = 7*60*60 = 25200.

to.description: Time of day in seconds at which the period ends, e.g. 20:00 = 20*60*60 = 72000.

feedinPrice.description: Price in cents per kWh (ct/kWh) for fed in energy in the period [from, to).

offtakePrice.description: Price in cents per kWh (ct/kWh) for consumed energy in the period [from, to).

priceUnit.description: Currency unit which the prices are (ct/kWh).

averagePriceDay.description: Average price of the second to last day in EUR/MWh.

periodStart.description: Starting date at which the prices are fetched in RFC3339 format.

periodEnd.description: Ending date at which the prices are fetched in RFC3339 format.

totalPrices.description:
Contains an array of arrays in the format [time, price].

The fetched prices are in the following order:
* Average prices for each day between [PeriodStart, SecondToLastDay].
* Prices for the second to last day from the given interval with resolution 1h.
* Price for the last day of the given interval with resolution 1h.

GeneralException.title: General Exception
GeneralException.description: Represents a general error structure returned by our REST API.

message.description: Message represents the message reported to the user.

details.description:
Details represents detail information for the user to fix this
problem

allOf.title: ClientError - Not Found
allOf.description: Not Found indicates that the entity was not found.

allOf.title: ClientError - Validation
allOf.description:
Validation indicates that the request body contains fields which
does not pass the validation.

AccountSolution.description:
Represents the supported solutions within the account:
- HOME if the account contains household-like systems. 
- CHARGE if the account is used solely for charging station fleet management.
- GENERAL if unsure what the account should contain or if it's a mix of multiple solutions.
- SMART_DISTRICT if the account is used solely for smart district management.
If not set, the parent account's solution will be assumed.

AbstractAccount.title: Account
AbstractAccount.description:
An account describes an organizational unit to manage access to systems for one or multiple users.

This is the base type for the more concrete usages and not used directly within operations.

name.description: Name of the account, can be chosen freely but should be kept terse and descriptive.

email.description: The email field of the account can optionally be chosen e.g. for contact purposes (in order to reach the responsible person for the account).

AccountKind.description: If b2b, the account is a regular account. If end-user, the account is a customer account which contains just one user.

addressLine1.description:
First line of the location's address, typically containing the 
main information such as the street name and house number.

addressLine2.description:
Second line of the location's address, typically containing additional 
information such as apartment numbers, suite numbers, or other details 
that can help in identifying the exact location of the address.

addressLine3.description:
Third line of the location's address, typically containing any other 
details that can help in identifying the exact location of the address.

addressLine4.description:
Fourth line of the location's address, typically containing any other 
details that can help in identifying the exact location of the address.

timeZone.description: The TZ Identifier of the location's timezone.

Address.title: Address
Address.description: Represents a physical address of a customer.

postalcode.description: The postal code of the location.

telephone.description: The telephone number of the customer.

Account.title: Account
Account.description: An account describes an organizational unit to manage access to systems for one or multiple users.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the account.

parentID.description: Parent of the account for a tree-like account structure. Only the root account does not have a parent ID.

createdAt.description: Specifies when the account was created.

updatedAt.description: Specifies when the account was updated.

systemsCount.description: SystemCount is the number of systems assigned to this account

customization.description: Customization can be used to store arbitrary data.
Customization can be used to store arbitrary data.

allOf.title: ClientError - Bad Request
allOf.description:
Bad Request indicates that the request body is not a valid JSON or
it contains a invalid json type.

allOf.title: BadGatewayError
allOf.description: Indicates that there has been an error from an upstream server.

AbstractAPIToken.title: APIToken
AbstractAPIToken.description:
API Tokens can be used as an alternative to Bearer Authentication for making requests.
They are instead used as an in-header API Key.

expiresAt.description:
Time at which the token expires in UTC using the RFC3339 format.

**WARNING** - if `expiresAt` is not set, the token will never expire. We strongly recommend
that you set an expiration date to help keep your account and information secure.

createdAt.description: Time at which the token was created in UTC using the RFC3339 format.

AbstractPolicyGroup.title: Policy Group
AbstractPolicyGroup.description:
A policy group describes the permissions of a group.

This is the base type for the more concrete usages and not used directly within operations.

description.description: Description of the group, omitted if empty

id.description: Unique identifier of the policy group.

accountID.description: Unique identifier of the creator account.

createdAt.description: Time at which the policy group was created in UTC (RFC 3339 format).

updatedAt.description: Time at which the policy group was last updated in UTC (RFC 3339 format).

userCount.description: Amount of users that are in this group.

Language.title: Language
Language.description: The language information of the user.

tag.description:
Tag is the IETF language tag's primary identifier for this language.

See [here](https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt) and the example below for more information.

name.description: The name of the language in English.

nameNative.description: The name of the language in the language itself.

UserWithoutAuth.title: User
UserWithoutAuth.description:
Represents a user of the Xenon platform.

This is the base type for the more concrete usages and not used directly within operations.

id.description: Unique identifier of the user.

accountID.description: Unique identifier of the account that the user belongs to.

newPassword.description: Used to set a new password for the user.

mfaEnabled.description: Indicates whether MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) is enabled.

mfaReset.description: Can be set to true if MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) needs to to be reset. This will remove the MFA.

createdAt.description: Time at which the user was created in UTC using the RFC3339 format.

updatedAt.description: Time at which the user was last updated in UTC using the RFC3339 format.

fullName.description: Full name of the user typically consisting of first name and last name.

email.description: The email address of the user that is used for login.

groups.description: Policy groups attached to this user which determine the effective permissions through policies.

userID.description: Reference to the user to which the API token belongs. Can be used to set the token's "scope" by assigning groups to the user.

email.description: Used to specify the email address associated with the user responsible for the organizational token upon its creation (account email is used by default).

groups.description: Used to specify the permissions assigned to the organizational token.

items.description: Unique identifier of the policy group.

token.description:
This token can be used for authenticating further requests as an alternative to Bearer Authentication.

Example: Set the header field `Authorization` to `Token gxo_SUDJmIoABC1337JiAuKBZuauC0ff331HNPR0`. 
To set the permissions of it, you can assign a group to the newly created associated organizational user, see `userID`.

**ATTENTION**: Please keep the token secret and treat it like a password! The token is only available immediately after creation and can not be retrieved again afterwards.

AccountKindWithDefault.description: If b2b, the account is a regular account. If end-user, the account is a customer account which contains just one user.

parentID.description: Parent of the account for a tree-like account structure. If not set, defaults to the authenticated account.

groups.description: the IDs of the policy groups that the account should be assigned to.

customization.description: Customization can be used to store arbitrary data.

targetID.description: AccountID of the target account that the account should be moved into.

SystemSolution.description:
Represents the solution that the system uses:
- HOME if the system is for a household. 
- CHARGE if the system is for charging station fleet management.

SystemCurtailmentStrategy.description:
The curtailment strategy describes how appliances shall be curtailed.
  * SERIES: Appliances get in order as much as possible; order: first order by least number of energy importing phases and second order lexicographically by appliance ID.
  * EQUALLY: Every appliance gets equally (fair) curtailed.
  * PROPORTIONAL: Proportional according to the desired energy to charge (current SoC, desired SoC and max. energy) and the desired charging time set via the API.

Location.title: Location
Location.description: Represents a GPS location with longitude and latitude.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the location.

longitude.description: The geographic coordinate that specifies the east–west position of the location.

latitude.description: The geographic coordinate that specifies the north–south position of the location.

MetadataWizard.title: Wizard
MetadataWizard.description: Represents the metadata to keep track of the current wizard step.

step.description: Represents the last completed wizard step.

DateTime.description: Date time combination in RFC3339 format.

syncInterval.description: SyncInterval defines the period in seconds for data to be synchronized between gridBox and cloud DER API.

ttl.description: TTL defines the time to live in seconds for entity.

disabled.description: Disabled disables the sync of entities.

DerAPISettings.title: DerAPISettings
DerAPISettings.description: DerAPISettings represents the metadata related to DER API configuration.

enabledCloudAPI.description: EnabledCloudAPI enables assets control with cloud DER API.

MetadataEMS.title: MetadataEMS
MetadataEMS.description: MetadataEMS represents the energy management allowances.

agreedEMSTerms.description: AgreedEMSTerms indicates if the customers accepts the ems terms.

enabledEMS.description: EnabledEMS indicates if gridBox should activate the ems.

agreedDynamicPVControlTerms.description: AgreedDynamicPVControlTerms indicates if the customer accepts the dynamic pc control terms.

enabledDynamicPVControl.description: EnabledDynamicPVControl indicates if the gridBox should activate the dynamic pv control.

agreedForecastBasedEMSTerms.description: AgreedForecastBasedEMSTerms indicates if the customer accepts the forecast-based EMS.

enabledForecastBasedEMS.description: EnabledForecastBasedEMS indicates if the gridBox should activate the forecast-based EMS.

agreedPriorityConfigurationTerms.description: AgreedPriorityConfigurationTerms indicates if the customer accepts the priority configuration terms.

enabledPriorityConfiguration.description: EnabledPriorityConfiguration indicates if the gridBox should activate the priority configuration.

agreedPowerManagementTerms.description: AgreedPowerManagementTerms indicates if the customer accepts the power management terms.

enabledPowerManagement.description: EnabledPowerManagement indicates if the gridBox should activate the power management.

enabledStaticPowerManagement.description: EnabledStaticPowerManagement indicates if the gridBox should activate the static power management.

enabledPowerImportPeakOptimization.description: EnabledPowerImportPeakOptimization indicates if the gridBox should activate the 15min avg. energy optimization algorithm.

powerImportPeakPerOptimizationInterval.description: Describes the amount of imported energy in a 15 minutes interval in mVA.

enabledPVSurplusChargeMode.description:
Indicates whether the gridBox should activate the system-wide PV surplus EV charging mode or not.

The individual EV configuration charging mode always takes precedence.

powerPVSurplusThreshold.description:
Specifies the PV surplus charging threshold in mVA. 

WARN: This field is deprecated and not supported any more.

pVSurplusActiveAt.description: Specifies the time at which the PV surplus charging mode is activated.

pVSurplusInactiveAt.description: Specifies the time at which the PV surplus charging mode is deactivated.

enabledBatteryFullGridCharge.description: If enabled, the battery can be recharged from the grid with 100% of the maximum charging power. If disabled, the default value is 30%.

enabledLessConstrainingSOCLimits.description: If enabled, allows applying both "more constraining" and "less constraining" SOC limits. If disabled, only the "most constraining" SOC limits are considered.

enabledTimeOfUseOptimization.description:
Indicates if time of use optimization is enabled for the system.
*Deprecated* - Use `systems/{systemID}/timeofuse/options` endpoint instead.

disableAveragePmaxCalculation.description: Disables the average pMax calculation. It means EMS will not calculate average pMax and will get the default value instead.

excludeApplianceTypes.description: Appliance types to be ignored by the EMS. Updating this field to an empty array clears it. **Please note that this currently requires the box to be restarted to take effect**.

evChargingReallocationTolerance.description: Specifies the maximum power that can be drawn to charge an EV in case the PV surplus is not sufficient (in mVA).

MetadataEnergy.title: Energy Metadata
MetadataEnergy.description: represents the metadata related to the energy use case.

installer.description: Installer is the person who has installed the systems.

norminalPower.description: The system's maximal power production in Wp (for historical reasons the word "norminal" is used instead of the correct term "nominal power").

curtailment.description: Curtailment is the percentage of system's norminal power at which the pv inverters should stop feeding into the grid. (0-1)

heatingSystem.description: HeatingSystem represents the type of the heating system.

agreedEMSTerms.description: AgreedEMSTerms indicates if the customers accepts the ems terms.

smartMeterInstallationTimestamp.description: The time the smart meter has been installed (if any), in RFC3339 format.

MetadataEnergySupplier.title: Energy Supplier
MetadataEnergySupplier.description: MetadataEnergySupplier represents the metadata related to energy supplier.

type.description: Type determines if gridX is the energy supplier. The value is either "GRIDX" or "OTHER".

unitPrice.description: UnitPrice is unit price per kWh in EU cent. Deprecated - Use TariffV2 instead.

baseFee.description: BaseFee is the monthly base fee.

feedInTariff.description: FeedInTariff is the cost-based compensation in EUR cent for feeding in. Deprecated - Use TariffV2 instead.

expectedConsumption.description: ExpectedConsumption is the expected annual consumption in kWh.

MetadataSmartMeter.title: Smart Meter
MetadataSmartMeter.description: Represents the metadata to report if a smart meter has been installed.

installed.description: Reports if the smart meter has been installed.

hasInstallationDate.description: Reports if the provider has sent us a installation date that can be found in energy metadata.

MetadataElectricVehicle.title: ElectricVehicle
MetadataElectricVehicle.description: MetadataElectricVehicle represents the metadata related to the ev. It acts as a fallback EV, if no matching EV profile has been found. See ElectricVehicleProfiles.

manufacturer.description: Represents the manufacturer of the EV.

model.description: Represents the model of the EV.

capacity.description: Represents the capacity of the EV in Wh.

averageConsumption.description: Represents the average consumption of the EV in Wh/km.

phasesCount.description: Number of phases used for charging the EV (range 1-3).

MetadataElectricVehicleProfile.title: ElectricVehicleProfile
MetadataElectricVehicleProfile.description: MetadataElectricVehicleProfile represents the metadata related to the ev. It has more information like ChargingStationApplianceID which contains the ID of the charging station appliance the EV is assigned to.

chargingStationApplianceID.description: Represents the charging station appliance the EV is assigned to.

SavingKind.description:
Saving due to various optimizations.

* `CAPACITY_TARIFF_OPTIMIZATION` - Saving due to capacity tariff optimization
* `SOLAR_GENERATION` - Saving due to optimal usage of solar generation
* `TIME_OF_USE_OPTIMIZATION` - Saving due to optimization of day/night tariffs

AbstractSystem.title: System
AbstractSystem.description:
A System represents the logical view of one gateway and its appliances.

For example, a household can be represented as a system with a gateway such as a 
gridBox, and its connected appliances.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description:
Labels help you organize your systems.

Pass one or more labels to replace the set of labels. Send an empty array ([]) to clear all
labels from your system.

**Deprecated** - Labels will no longer be supported starting from 01.03.2024

priorities.description: Allows prioritisation of EMS functionalities by appliance type.

appliancePriorities.description:
Allows prioritisation of EMS functionalities by appliance UUIDs.
This option takes precendence over `priorities` field as it is more explicit.

tariffID.description:
TariffID is used to reference a (deprecated) time of use tariff for a system.

**Deprecated** - Use TariffV2 instead.

plan.description: Charge plan of the system. Must be one of the accounts assigned charge plans.

operatingSince.description: Date since when the system is active in RFC3339 format.

AbstractEVChargingSchedule.title: EV Charging Schedule
AbstractEVChargingSchedule.description:
An Electric Vehicle charging schedule represents an interval in which
the electric vehicle is supposed to charge at a defined limit.

from.description: Specifies when the schedule should start in RFC3339 format.

to.description: Specifies when the schedule should end in RFC3339 format.

limit.description: The maximum amount of power in Watts that will be used for scheduling charging in the interval [from, to].

updatedAt.description: Specifies when the schedule was updated the last time.

AbstractGateway.title: Gateway
AbstractGateway.description:
A gateway used to monitor and control appliances.

For instance, our beloved gridbox is a gateway.

debugModeUntil.description: Date until which debug messages are logged in RFC3339 format.

GatewayType.description:
Type of the gateway.

**Deprecated** - Non-physical gateways will no longer be supported from 01.03.2024. This field will consequently be removed.

status.description:
Indicates the connection status. Is one of:
  * `AVAILABLE`: Gateway/Appliance has sent data in the last two minutes
  * `TEMPORARILY_UNAVAILABLE`: Gateway/Appliance has not sent data in the last two minutes
  * `UNAVAILABLE`: Gateway/Appliance has not sent data in the last 24 hours

contactedAt.description: When the gateway/appliance has last contacted the gridX cloud.

AdditionalIdentifier.title: Additional identifiers of the gridBox.
AdditionalIdentifier.description: Additional identifiers used by the gridBox.

service.description: The service this identifier is referring to, e.g the protocol used for the appliance-gridBox handshake

identifier.description: The actual identifier, e.g "SKI" used in the TLS certificate for the communication. If type is "SKI", it is hexadecimal-encoded.

ScannerName.description: The name of the scanner which searches for the appliance in the network.

id.description: Unique identifier of a gateway.

createdAt.description: Date when the Gateway was created in RFC3339 format.

updatedAt.description: Date when the Gateway was last updated in RFC3339 format.

registeredAt.description: Date when the Gateway was first registered in RFC3339 format.

vendorID.description: ID of the vendor account to which the corresponding system is assigned.

startcode.description: Code used to register a new gateway.

additionalIdentifiers.description: Additional identifiers used by the gateway.

scanners.description: List of scanner names that are enabled for this gateway.

applianceComposition.description: Appliance types that are connected to the gateway for overview purposes.

SystemWithoutProductOption.title: System
SystemWithoutProductOption.description:
A System represents the logical view of one gateway and its appliances.
  
For example, a household can be represented as a system with a gateway such as a 
gridBox, and its connected appliances.

id.description: Unique identifier of a system.

createdAt.description: Date when the system was created in RFC3339 format.

updatedAt.description: Date when the system was last updated in RFC3339 format.

chargingIntervals.description: Displays charging intervals of the system's EV charging stations.

gateways.description: The gateways of which this system is comprised.

status.description:
Status of the system: 
  - OK: If there has been a successful heartbeat of an attached gateway recently.
  - WARNING: If the last heartbeat of an attached gateway is a longer time but less than 24h ago.
  - ERROR: If the last heartbeat of an attached gateway is longer than 24h ago. 
  - UNEFINED: otherwise

EmbeddedAccounts.title: Embedded accounts
EmbeddedAccounts.description: Hierarchy of accounts the system belongs to, from the authenticated account down to the end customer's.

AbstractProductOption.title: Product Option
AbstractProductOption.description:
A product option describes a set of features whose access should be restricted from or granted to users of a system.

Systems can be assigned a product option to manage their access to these features.

This is the base type for the more concrete usages and not used directly within operations.

description.description: Describes the purpose of the product option.

AbstractProductFunctionality.description:
A product functionality describes a feature.

It is used to manage access to this feature via product options.

This is the base type for the more concrete usages and not used directly within operations.

hide.description: Indicates whether the product functionality should be hidden or shown.

description.description: Describes the purpose of the product functionality.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product functionality.
Unique identifier of the product option.

accountID.description: Unique identifier of the account that owns the product option.

isDefault.description: Indicates whether the product option should be assigned by default to all systems of the owning account.

functionalities.description: The default functionalities that a product option restricts access to. Deprecated - Use `showFunctionalities` and `hideFunctionalities` instead.

hideFunctionalities.description: The default functionalities that a product option restricts access to. Must be of type `hide=true`.

showFunctionalities.description: The extra functionalities that a product option grants access to. Must be of type `hide=false`.

System.title: System
System.description:
A System represents the logical view of one gateway and its appliances.

For example, a household can be represented as a system with a gateway such as a 
gridBox, and its connected appliances.

productOptionUpdatedAt.description: Time at which the system's product option was last changed in RFC3339 format.

users.description:
The users belonging to this system.
Only set if `embed` query parameter includes `user`.

moveSystemsAndCustomers.description:
- `true`: Moves the system from the origin account to the target account (accountID parameter) and its parent accounts. The customers that belong to that account are also moved to the target account.
- `false`: Assigns the system to the target account (accountID parameter) and its parent accounts.

moveVendorID.description:
`true` by default when moveSystemsAndCustomers is `true`.
  - `true`: Updates the vendorID of the gateway of the specified system to the target accountID.
  - `false`: Does not update the vendorID of the gateway of the specified system.

uuids.description: System IDs that will be moved to the target account.

moveSystemsAndCustomers.description:
- `true`: Unassigns the system from the given account (accountID parameter). Moves the customer account to the parent account of the account the system is unassigned from (accountID parameter).
- `false`: Unassigns the system from the given account (accountID parameter).

moveVendorID.description:
`true` by default when moveSystemsAndCustomers is `true`.

  - `true`: Updates the vendorID of the gateway of the specified system to the target accounts' parentID.
  - `false`: Does not update the vendorID of the gateway of the specified system.

uuids.description: System IDs that will be removed from the target account.

PolicyDocumentAssign.title: Assign Policy Document to Account
PolicyDocumentAssign.description: Holds the data required to assign an existing policy document by its ID to an existing account.

id.description: Unique identifier of the policy document to be assigned to the account.

accountID.description: Unique identifier of the creator account.

policies.description: the ID's of the policy documents that the group should be assigned to.

wizardCompleted.description: True if the wizard has been completed.

lastRequestAt.description: Specifies when the last request has been made by the customer. This field might not be always up-to-date and it might take some time for changes to be propagated.

AbstractPolicyDocument.title: Policy Document
AbstractPolicyDocument.description: A policy document describes the permissions of the user which can be used for access management.

AbstractPolicyStatement.title: Policy Statement
AbstractPolicyStatement.description: A policy statement grants or restricts the permission to perform an action.

id.description: Unique identifier of the policy statement.

action.description: The action that this statement represents. An action is an operation on a resource.

effect.description: Whether this statement restricts or grants the permission to perform the described action.

fields.description: Used for fine-grained control over request bodies, e.g. to allow/deny a certain field in the payload.

resource.description:
Hierarchical structure over resources to control endpoint access.

For instance, "accounts:*" means that the user can read/modify any account (represented by the wildcard '*').

id.description: Unique identifier of the policy statement.

createdAt.description: Date when the policy statement was created in UTC (RFC 3339 format).

updatedAt.description: Date when the policy statement was last updated in UTC (RFC 3339 format).

id.description: Unique identifier of the policy document.

createdAt.description: Date when the policy was created in UTC (RFC 3339 format).

updatedAt.description: Date when the policy was last updated in UTC (RFC 3339 format).

eventType.description: Type of the event that triggered the notification.

content.description: Textual content that is displayed within the dashboard.

read.description: If true, the message has been read by the user, otherwise it was not read yet.

timestamp.description: Time at which the event with `eventType` was issued by the notification system in UTC in RFC3339 format.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the notification.

createdAt.description: Time at which the notification was created in UTC in RFC3339 format.

updatedAt.description: Time at which the notification was updated in UTC in RFC3339 format.

status.description:
Indicates the connection status of an appliance.
    
The connection status of an appliance is determined by the gateway. The gateway regularly
sends the connection status of all connected appliances.

It is one of:
- `AVAILABLE`: Appliance was reported as available by the gateway.
- `UNAVAILABLE`: Appliance was reported as unavailable by the gateway.
- `UNKNOWN`: The gateway didn't report a status for the appliance.

In case the connection status of the gateway this appliance belongs to is `TEMPORARILY_UNAVAILABLE` or `UNAVAILABLE`
the status is always `UNAVAILABLE`.

contactedAt.description:
No longer supported. 

Will be set approximately to a value matching the status field.
If the appliance is `AVAILABLE`, it will be the current datetime.
If the appliance is `UNAVAILABLE`, it will be a datetime 24 hours in the past.

ApplianceStatus.description:
Status of the appliance. This field is set dynamically in the appliance handler.

**Deprecated** - Use `ConnectionStatus` instead.

ApplianceType.description:
Describes the 'physical' type of the appliance.

See `kind` for further distinction of the type in terms of the appliance's purpose/role,
e.g. appliance with type=INVERTER and kind=BATTERY represents a battery inverter.

ApplianceReverseFlow.description:
If true, changes the energy flow's direction.

If during installation the input/output wiring is mixed up, set it to true in order to compensate for that.
This impact the consumption/production calculation as follows: 
It switches the algebraic sign of the appliance's measurements, e.g. if an appliance measurement showed supply (+), it will change to feed-in (-) after this field is set to true (and vice versa).

ApplianceRoom.description: The physical room/location of the appliance in the building.

interface.description: Used network interface such as "eth0", "vpn0" etc.

ApplianceParent.description: Specifies the parent appliance ID, for an appliance which is a child of a `CONTAINER` or `INVERTER` of kind `HYBRID`.

disabled.description: If true, disable electrical load of the appliance (e.g. stops charging for EV charging station).

origin.description:
Specifies who created the appliance. This can be one of:
- `GRIDBOX` if the appliance was found during a scan using a gridBox.
- `API` if a user of the gridX API used the 'Create Appliance' endpoint
  to create this appliance.
- `UNKNOWN` otherwise.

uri.description:
Contains an URI identifying the exact resource that created this appliance.

If origin is 'GRID_BOX' the value will point to the gateway object of the gridBox. If
origin is 'API' the value will specify the user that made the request to the gridX API.
The 'UNKNOWN' origin should not occur in practice and is reserved for special cases (for now).

CommissioningKind.title: Commissioning Kind
CommissioningKind.description:
Indicates special requirements to be fulfilled during the commissioning for this appliance.

If empty or unset (default), the appliance can be commissioned as regular.
- `property:CryptoSettings` means that the appliance property `CryptoSettings` needs to be set, e.g. for authenticating towards it with an appliance-specific API token.
- `flow:Pairing` means that a coupling or pairing flow has to be initiated and run-through in order for the appliance to behave correctly.

ApplianceState.title: Appliance State
ApplianceState.description: State an appliance can be in.

StateTransition.title: State Transition
StateTransition.description: Defines the properties of a transition an appliance can go through.

start.description: The starting state of the appliance.

target.description: The target state of the appliance.

AbstractState.title: State
AbstractState.description: Contains information about the appliance's state.

current.description: The state the appliance is currently in.

transitions.description:
List with all the possible state transitions an appliance can go through. 
An appliance can go from a `starting` state to a `target` state.

State.title: State
State.description: Contains information about the appliance's state.

socMax.description: The maximum state of charge an energy storage can be charged to in a range from [0-100] in %.

socLockMax.description:
The threshold above which no charging is allowed once SoC max is reached, in a range from [0-100] in %.
Must be smaller than or equal to socMax.

socMin.description: The minimum state of charge an energy storage can be discharged to in a range from [0-100] in %.

socLockMin.description:
The threshold below which no discharging is allowed once SoC min is reached, in a range from [0-100] in %.
Must be larger than or equal to socMin.

socDeepDischarge.description:
The lowest state of charge an energy storage can reach, in a range from [0-100] in %.
Below this it is not usable and a forced recharge to at least socMin is required.

phaseMapping.description:
Contains three indices representing the actual phases on the grid connection point this appliance is connected to. 
Note that the first phase has index 0 and last phase index 2.
The index of the sequence is the phase on the gcp and the values are the appliance phases. Unused phases are marked with -1.

temperatureExtremeMax.description: The temperature to which the system should be heated up to in °C, if there is an energy surplus.

temperatureExtremeMin.description: The minimum temperature the system can reach in °C.

temperatureComfortMax.description: The temperature to which the system should be heated up to in °C, if there is no energy surplus.

temperatureComfortMin.description: The temperature at which the system starts to heat up to in °C.

surplusThreshold.description: The supply surplus threshold for the EMS to activate the appliance.

updatedAt.description: Specifies when the energy management settings were updated the last time.

key.description: Crypto key data that is accessible to the appliance.

createdAt.description: Specifies when the crypto key was created.

updatedAt.description: Specifies when the crypto key was updated the last time.

BaseAppliance.title: Base Appliance
BaseAppliance.description:
BaseAppliance contains fields that all appliances have in common.

Specific appliance types extend this schema and add new fields.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the appliance.

createdAt.description: Specifies when the appliance was created.

updatedAt.description: Specifies when the appliance was updated the last time.

cryptoSettings.title: Crypto Settings
cryptoSettings.description: Contains a list of crypto setting keys that are associated with the appliance.

InverterKind.description:
Indicates the role of the inverter.

Setting the kind impacts the system measurements. So it's best to set it up correctly as early as possible
in accordance to the actual installation in order for the measurement calculation to be correct (best during commissioning).

AbstractBatteryInformation.title: Battery Information
AbstractBatteryInformation.description: The battery specific information for inverters of BATTERY and HYBRID kind.

controllable.description: Controllable is true if the battery charging/discharging can be controlled.

dischargeLimit.description: DischargeLimit is the minimum state of charge in % from 0-100 to discharge to.

rechargeLimit.description:
RechargeLimit is the state of charge in % from 0-100 to which the battery needs to 
recharge before allowing discharging again.

controlSettings.description: Indicates the currently desired control settings for the battery.

value.description: Represents the charge/discharge power in mW.

maxActivePowerOutput.description: Maximum active power output of the inverter in mW; set manually. Zero if not set.

type.description: Describes the specific type of the inverter.

nominalPowerLimit.description: Designed maximal power output of the inverter in mW.

hybridCalcMode.description: The calculation mode for inverters of HYBRID kind.

HardwareStatus.title: Hardware Status
HardwareStatus.description:
HardwareStatus provides information about the condition of the inverter and in case of issues, 
possible follow-up actions the user/installer can perform to resolve them.

action.description: Recommended action to resolve ERROR/WARNING state.

errorCode.description: Inverter manufacturer/model dependent error code formatted as it would be shown on display.

description.description: Contains details about the inverter ERROR and WARNING states.

BatteryInformation.title: Battery Information
BatteryInformation.description: The battery specific information for inverters of BATTERY and HYBRID kind.

Inverter.title: Inverter
Inverter.description:
Inverter represents a monitor-/controllable inverter. It can be of kind:
- `PV`/`PV_EXTERNAL`: used as photovoltaic only.
- `BATTERY`: used as battery only.
- `HYBRID`: used as both photovoltaic and battery.
- `UNKNOWN`: default, when the inverter kind is not determined.

location.description: Indicates that the meter is in front of given location for measuring the consumption and production.

type.description: Describes the specific type of the meter.

MeterKind.description:
Indicates what the meter measures.
Setting the kind impacts the system measurements. So it's best to set it up correctly as early as possible in accordance to the actual installation in order for the measurement calculation to be correct (best during commissioning).

type.description: Describes the specific type of the heat pump.

controllable.description: Specifies whether this appliance is controllable by the EMS.

behindGCP.description: Specifies whether this heat pump exists behind a GCP meter.

withOwnTariff.description: Specifies whether this heat pump has its own meter and tariff.

userControlEnabled.description: Specifies whether EMS control of this appliance is enabled by the user.

firmware.description: Firmware version of the heat pump.

HeatPump.title: Heat Pump
HeatPump.description: Heat Pump represents a monitor-/controllable heat pump.

EVSEID.description: The EVSE-ID related to the charge point.

EVLoadManagementParameters.title: EvLoadManagementParameters
EVLoadManagementParameters.description:
Load management configuration for EV charging stations.

**Deprecated** - Use the system's EV charging station configuration instead.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the load management is enabled.

manufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the ev charging station.

model.description: Model of the ev charging station.

firmware.description: Firmware version of the ev charging station.

EVStation.title: EV Charging Station
EVStation.description: EV Charging Station represents a monitor-/controllable electric vehicle charging station.

HeatMeter.title: Heat Meter
HeatMeter.description: Heat Meter represents a monitor-/controllable heat meter.

IODeviceInputAction.title: IO Device Input Action
IODeviceInputAction.description: One individual input action, that can be registered to a channel of a fieldbus coppler appliance.

value.description: Value of the action. Unit must be derived from Name.

bitMask.description: BitMask used to identify the channel.

bitValue.description: BitValue used to trigger the action.

IODeviceOutputActionSGReady.title: IO Device Output Action SGReady
IODeviceOutputActionSGReady.description: Used to specify a connection to a heat pump supporting the SGReady standard.

state.description: Represents one state of the sg ready standard.

IODeviceOutputAction.title: IO Device Output Action
IODeviceOutputAction.description: An individual output action, that can be registered to an output channel of an IODevice.

bitValue.description: The value to write to the IODevice's output channel. Each action has its own bit value, to allow arbitrary combinations to be written to the output channel.

IODeviceOutputChannel.title: IO Device Output Channel
IODeviceOutputChannel.description: Represents one output channel of the IODevice.

bitMask.description: Bit mask identifying the output channel.

actions.description: Actions (name/value pairs) that are applied to the channel when enabled.

type.description: Describes the specific type of the device.

inChannelsCount.description: The number of input ports on the device, real physical ports you can connect a cable to.

outChannelsCount.description: The number of output ports on the device, real physical ports you can connect a cable to.

inputChannels.description: Input channels of the fieldbus coupler, containing actions.

outputChannels.description:
Output channels of the IODevice, containing actions. An output channel must not always use exactly one port, but can use multiple physical connections.
SGReady heat pumps for example are connected using two output ports (which are grouped in one OutputChannel).

firmware.description: Firmware version of the io device.

IODevice.title: IO Device
IODevice.description: IO devices represent configuration options that can be applied for appliances of the fieldbus coupler type

type.description: Describes the specific type of the heater.

medium.description: The medium the heater is working with.

nominalPower.description: The nominal power of the heater.

type.description: Describes the specific type of the container.

Container.title: Container
Container.description: Container represents a container appliance, used to group multiple child appliances.

Appliance.title: Appliance
Appliance.description:
Appliance represents a monitor-/controllable device such as Inverters,
Meters and Heat Pumps.

AbstractBiddingZone.description:
The bidding zone determines from which electricity market bidding zone the raw market prices for
market data tariffs are used.

The bidding zone is the ENTSOE-E Area EIC codes (Y).
See https://www.entsoe.eu/data/energy-identification-codes-eic/eic-approved-codes/ & https://www.entsoe.eu/data/energy-identification-codes-eic/eic-approved-codes/
for available codes.

Assets.description: A List of Assets and metadata about the list.

Asset.description: An Asset as its defined for the gridX Platform.

status.description:
An asset is considered as `AVAILABLE` if it sent a heartbeat in the past 5 minutes. Respectively, if there 
hasn't been a heartbeat in the past 5 minutes, the asset is considered as `UNAVAILABLE`. In case there isn't
a heartbeat (e.g. in case of a new Asset), the status will be `UNKNOWN`.

lastHeartbeatReceivedAt.description: At what time the last heartbeat was received.

AssetSystem.description: Minimal information about the System that the Asset belongs to.

NetworkSettings.description: Provides information about how to connect to the asset. The data varies depending on the driver.

AssetsMetadata.description: Provides information about the returned object, such as length of the list and distinct values.

counts.description:
This will only be available if the response is a list or contains multiple items. It provides multiple 
"counts" of the list that is being returned.

total.description:
The total number of objects in the list, regardless of any query parameters such as filtering or 
pagination.

filtered.description:
The number of objects in the list after the filters have been applied. This ignores pagination and will 
show how many objects are available with the given filters. This number will always be less than or 
equal to the `total` count.

priority.description: The higher the priority, the more energy the appliances will get; a cluster with higher priority will be curtailed least.

name.description: The cluster's name meant to be displayable to the user.

strategy.description: Identifies the specific curtailment approach within the cluster.

priorities.description: Defines the priority for the EMS.

maxPowerL1.description: The maximum power in W for phase L1.

maxPowerL2.description: The maximum power in W for phase L2.

maxPowerL3.description: The maximum power in W for phase L3.

maxPowerMargin.description: The maximum power safety margin in W.

maxPowerMarginL1.description: The maximum power safety margin in W for phase L1.

maxPowerMarginL2.description: The maximum power safety margin in W for phase L2.

maxPowerMarginL3.description: The maximum power safety margin in W for phase L3.

maxPowerWorstCase.description: The assumed maximum power in W in case of a lost connection.

maxPowerWorstCaseL1.description: The assumed maximum power in W in case of a lost connection for phase L1.

maxPowerWorstCaseL2.description: The assumed maximum power in W in case of a lost connection for phase L2.

maxPowerWorstCaseL3.description: The assumed maximum power in W in case of a lost connection for phase L3.

dynamicPowerDistribution.description: Specifies whether dynamic power distribution should be enabled or not.

id.description: Identifier of the cluster.

createdAt.description: Time at which the cluster was created in UTC using the ISO 8601 full-time format.

updatedAt.description: Time at which the cluster was updated in UTC using the ISO 8601 full-time format.

clusters.description: Clusters that belong to the cluster.

appliances.description: Appliances that belong to the cluster.

AuthEvent.title: AuthEvent
AuthEvent.description: AuthEvent represents auth events such as login, password reset.

ip.description: IP is the IP address of the person who created the event

allOf.title: ClientError - Unauthorized
allOf.description: The client isn't authorized to access the requested resource.

customization.description: Customization can be used to store arbitrary data.

maxImportTotal.description: Maximum total import power in W.

maxImportL1.description: Maximum total import power in the first phase in W.

maxImportL2.description: Maximum total import power in the second phase in W.

maxImportL3.description: Maximum total import power in the third phase in W.

maxImportEVMarginL1.description: Maximum import power margin in the first phase in W.

maxImportEVMarginL2.description: Maximum import power margin in the second phase in W.

maxImportEVMarginL3.description: Maximum import power margin in the third phase in W.

maxImportEVWorstCase.description: The assumed maximum charging power in W for all EVs in case the connection to the grid connection point is lost.

maxImportEVWorstCaseL1.description: The assumed maximum charging power in W for all EVs in case the connection to the grid connection point is lost for the first phase.

maxImportEVWorstCaseL2.description: The assumed maximum charging power in W for all EVs in case the connection to the grid connection point is lost for the second phase.

maxImportEVWorstCaseL3.description: The assumed maximum charging power in W for all EVs in case the connection to the grid connection point is lost for the third phase.

internalDeviceID.description: Unique ID to identify the gateway the import power limit belongs to.

createdAt.description: Time at which the import power limit was created in UTC using the RFC3339 format.

updatedAt.description: Time at which the import power limit was updated in UTC using the RFC3339 format.

PowerLimitDynamic.title: Import power limits stored with the dynamic API.

maxImportMeasuredTimestamp.description: Time at which the import power limit was created in UTC using the RFC3339 format.

maxImportTotal.description: Maximum total import power in mW.

maxImportL1.description: Maximum total import power in the first phase in mW.

maxImportL2.description: Maximum total import power in the second phase in mW.

maxImportL3.description: Maximum total import power in the third phase in mW.

maxImportEvMarginTotal.description: maxImportTotal - importEVMarginTotal is the maximum import power considered in total in mW.

maxImportEvMarginL1.description: Maximum import power margin in the first phase in mW.

maxImportEvMarginL2.description: Maximum import power margin in the second phase in mW.

maxImportEvMarginL3.description: Maximum import power margin in the third phase in mW.

maxImportEvMarginWorstCaseTotal.description: The assumed maximum charging power in mW for all EVs in case the connection to the grid connection point is lost.

maxImportEvMarginWorstCaseL1.description: The assumed maximum charging power in mW for all EVs in case the connection to the grid connection point is lost for the first phase.

maxImportEvMarginWorstCaseL2.description: The assumed maximum charging power in mW for all EVs in case the connection to the grid connection point is lost for the second phase.

maxImportEvMarginWorstCaseL3.description: The assumed maximum charging power in mW for all EVs in case the connection to the grid connection point is lost for the third phase.

systemID.description: Unique ID to identify the system the import power limits belong to.

UserLimitSet.title: User Limit Request Body
UserLimitSet.description: Set the user limit, price and enable or disable the limit.

userLimit.description: Limit set by the user in W.

userLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the limit set by the user. Fallback is the suggested limit.

price.description: Price for the given capacity tariff (set by the user) in €/kW.

enabled.description:
Enables or disables the capacity tariff.
If enabled, energy management system uses the `effectiveLimit` as an upper bound on a 15 minute average base.

value.description: Limit set by the energy provider as a suggestion for the user in W.
Peak power set by the EMS in W.

BatteryControlSettings.title: Battery Control Settings
BatteryControlSettings.description:
Represents settings for a battery, indicating whether it is set to
charge or discharge.

value.description: represents the charge/discharge power in mW

CapacityTariff.title: Capacity Tariff
CapacityTariff.description: Represents the set tariff information for a defined power import peak limit.

userLimit.description: Limit set by the user in W.

userLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the limit set by the user. Fallback is the suggested limit. Default is disabled.

price.description: Price for the given capacity tariff (set by the user) in €/kW.

recommendedLimit.description:
Limit set by the energy provider as a suggestion for the user in W.
If the limit is deleted, it's not part of the capacity tariff response.

peakPower.description:
Maximum peak power. If it exceeds both the user and the recommended limit it is set as `effectiveLimit`.
If the value is deleted, it's not part of the capacity tariff response.

effectiveLimit.description: Defines which limit is used by the energy management system (either user or recommended).

enabled.description:
Enables or disables the capacity tariff.
If enabled, energy management system uses the `effectiveLimit` as an upper bound on a 15 minute average base.

from.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format that marks the beginning of the validity period for the forecast.

to.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format that marks the end of the validity period for the forecast.

lastUpdated.description: Last time when the forecast was updated.

from.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format that marks the beginning of the period.

to.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format that marks the end of the period.

importActivePower.description: The forecasted import active power in Watts.

exportActivePower.description: The forecasted export active power in Watts.

from.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format that marks the beginning of the validity period for the status history.

to.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format that marks the end of the validity period for the status history.

from.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format that marks the beginning of the period.

to.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format that marks the end of the period.

StatusValue.description:
Operational status of Time-of-Use for a specific run.

* `ONLINE` - Time-of-Use optimization is running successfully.
* `SUBOPTIMAL` - Time-of-Use optimization is running suboptimally.
* `OFFLINE` - Time-of-Use optimization failed.
* `DISABLED` - Time-of-Use optimization is disabled for the system.
* `INITIALIZING` - Time-of-Use optimization is initializing, it may take up to 48h.

startcode.description: Code used to register a new gateway.

vendorID.description: ID of the vendor account to which the corresponding system is assigned.

Scanner.title: Scanner
Scanner.description: Represents a scanner within a scan.

id.description: Unique identifier of a scanner.

startedAt.description: The time at which the scan has started.

finishedAt.description: The time at which the scan has finished.

Scan.title: Scan
Scan.description: Represents a group of scanners than have to run on a specific gridbox.

id.description: Unique identifier of a scan.

startedAt.description: The time at which the scan has started.

finishedAt.description: The time at which the scan has finished.

scanners.description: Represents a list of scanners that have to run.

appliances.description: Represents a list of appliances that have been detected during a scan.

JobType.description:
Represents the kind of the job. A job can be of type:
- `UNKNOWN_TYPE`
- `RESET`: Indicates that the application has to be reset.
- `SCAN`: Indicates that the application should start a scan.
- `RESTART`: Indicates that the application should restart.

JobState.description:
Represents the current state of the job. It can be one of:
* `UNKNOWN_STATE`
* `PENDING`: Indicates that the job waits to be fetched.
* `RECEIVED`: Indicates that the job has reached the gridbox.
* `STARTED`: Indicates that the job has been started.
* `DONE`: Indicates that the job is done.
* `ERROR`: Indicates that the job has failed.
* `CANCELED`: Indicates that the job was remotely cancelled.It might only have an impact if the state is still pending.

AbstractJob.description: Represents an application-based job on the gridBox.

requestedAt.description: Represents the time at which the job was requested.

JobExecution.title: Job Execution
JobExecution.description: Represents an execution of a job.

id.description: Unique identifier of a job execution.

succeeded.description: Indicates that the execution was successful.

startedAt.description: Represents the time at which the execution was started at the gridbox.

finishedAt.description: Represents the time at which the execution was finished.

id.description: Unique identifier of a job.

receivedAt.description: Represents the time at which the job was received by the gateway.

startedAt.description: Represents the time at which the job was started.

finishedAt.description: Represents the time at which the job was finished.

executions.description: Represents a set of job executions.

id.description: Unique identifier of a job.

BaseApplianceCreate.title: Base Appliance Create
BaseApplianceCreate.description:
BaseApplianceCreate contains fields of an appliance that can be set upon creation, regardless of appliance type.

Specific appliance types extend this schema and add new fields.

cryptoSettings.title: Crypto Settings
cryptoSettings.description: Contains a list of crypto setting keys that are associated with the appliance.

InverterCreate.title: Inverter Create
InverterCreate.description:
Inverter represents a monitor-/controllable inverter. It can be of kind:
- `PV`/`PV_EXTERNAL`: used as photovoltaic only.
- `BATTERY`: used as battery only.
- `HYBRID`: used as both photovoltaic and battery.
- `UNKNOWN`: default, when the inverter kind is not determined.

EVStationCreate.title: EV Charging Station Create
EVStationCreate.description: EV Charging Station represents a monitor-/controllable electric vehicle charging station.

HeatPumpCreate.title: Heat Pump Create
HeatPumpCreate.description: Heat Pump represents a monitor-/controllable heat pump.

HeatMeterCreate.title: Heat Meter Create
HeatMeterCreate.description: Heat Meter represents a monitor-/controllable heat meter.
